Job Title: Commercial Construction Project Manager

Location: Missouri City, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
PAY: $95,000 - $140,000LOCAL HOUSTON AREA PROJECT MANAGERS!
About Us:Anchor Construction & Management Inc. is a leading Commercial Construction firm specializing in upscale commercial project. With a serious commitment to client retention and satisfaction, we focus heavily on project schedules and deadlines. We have successfully delivered projects that stand as a testament to our expertise. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a dedicated and experienced Commercial Construction Project Manager to join our dynamic team.
Responsibilities:Project Planning and Execution:Develop and implement an overall project execution plan, ensuring adherence to strict schedules and budget constraints.Oversee all phases of construction projects, from initiation to completion, ensuring proper hand off to the client.Aggressively work towards "Beating the Schedule" along with maintaining the quality of the project.Work closely with Assistant Project Managers and ensure that subordinates are provided with training and knowledge to succeed.Budget and Cost Management:Monitor project budgets, expenses, and financial performance, making adjustments as needed to ensure profitability.Negotiate contracts with suppliers, subcontractors, and vendors to ensure work is properly scoped out and correctly priced. Ensure all contracts are issued and signed before the commencement of workApprove all invoices for the work completed during the billing periodOversee the client billing via AIA forms Risk Management:Identify potential risks and challenges, developing and implementing mitigation strategies.Be in constant communication with the preconstruction department and estimating department to identify all risks.Ensure all required compliance is adhered to and all inspections are completed timely.Maintain a healthy and positive relationship with Field Superintendents and all Subcontractors. Act as a liaison between office and field and keep the communication openClient Relations:Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, providing regular updates, job status reporting, and addressing any concerns.Foster strong client relationships through effective communication and exemplary project delivery.Represent Anchor Construction professionally in all dealings with all stakeholders.
Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Construction Management(Preferred), or related field.A minimum 5 years of experience as a Commercial Construction Project Manager with a track record of successfully completed projects.Strong knowledge of construction processes, building codes, and safety regulations(OSHA).Excellent leadership and communication skills.Highly Proficient in MS Office Suite, Estimating and Take-Off Software (Planswift/Bluebeam), Procore, MS Project, and other technologies.Willing to work in a highly dynamic work environment and able to multi-task between multiple projects.
Benefits:Competitive salary commensurate with experience.Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.Professional development opportunities.Dynamic and collaborative work environment.Great Incentive Plan for successful execution of projects

Experience Level (if available): None
